title: Synced data nowhere to be seen
content:
I have, as of earlier today, completed a new computer build. Along with that is new memory hardware that I have physically installed into the PC. When installing Firefox and attempting to get my bookmarks, search history, etc synced with the fresh installation, I noticed that it is wiped clean.

I don't remember if I ever disallowed Firefox to sync my data across the browser, but after looking at one of Mozilla's support articles such as this one: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/ive-lost-my-firefox-sync-account-information ... it states that "We encrypt your data with a key derived from your password in order to keep it safe on the server."

I cannot recover any of my data from the sync feature, so I'm wondering if a member of Mozilla Support could restore my data to my account? I tried looking for a direct contact page that includes a company email, phone number, or anything, but it seems like this is the only page for Mozilla-related support I can find, or rather, Thunderbird.
creator: Prismo

title: Why has the bookmarks menu in Firefox v89.0 increased in size?
content: I started up Firefox today and found that it had been updated to v89.0, without any announcement or permission from me. With this new version, the size of the bookmarks menu has been increased. There is now an enormous amount of wasted space between each entry, and this is causing me massive inconvenience when I'm trying to do basic browsing. Although my bookmarks are organised sensibly and tidily, this increase in menu size now means that I have to SCROLL the menu to find some of my entries near the bottom! That's ridiculous. I used to be able to navigate my bookmarks quickly, and this is important as I often have several tabs open at once as I co-ordinate tasks between different web pages. I now have to use much more mouse movement, and I have to use the mouse scroll wheel, just to perform basic tasks. This is slowing me down A LOT. How can I revert the bookmarks menu back to its previous size? How can I remove the wasted and unnecessary space between my bookmark entries? How can I speed up my browsing again? I have tried using the "CTRL+mousewheel" feature to adjust the zoom and size of my web pages, but unfortunately this has no effect at all on the user interface, including menu sizes, so it doesn't help solve my problem. Any help offered would be appreciated. If there is no solution, I guess I will have to revert back to the previous version of Firefox and turn off automatic updates somehow. It would be a shame to be forced into that, but if that's what it takes to regain control over my browser, then I'll have to do it.
creator: keith.c.ballard

content:
Dear Firefox Team,

That black Firefox background doesnt look good. For example, look at Microsoft Edge default tab background. It shows an image or theme colors which we have set. Opera gives us an option to set background image as wallpaper or it will change as per the theme set. Same thing expecting in Firefox also. I have searched for an option to set a new wallpaper in background but there was no such option.

I would request you that in your coming updates, kindly add an option to set a new wallpaper atleast of our choice. It would look great and more appealing.

Thank you.

title: Lost Logins and Passwords...AGAIN!
content:
Have been a consistent user of Firefox for years and years! Never had a problem with it Saving my Logins and Passwords until last June, suddenly lost it all (over 10 years worth of logins and passwords!!!) Could not recover them no matter what I did (and I followed all the tips and tricks anyone has posted in the forums). Ok, so it gave us a chance to clean out the junk sites we don't go to anymore....

Then it happened again a month later. And then the month after that. And the month after that. Every month since June. Now its been a year and I've lost it all again - by this time I don't even bother trying what everyone says will work, because none of it has.

I'm sick and tired of losing my logins and passwords for no apparent reason. It doesn't matter if I'm logged into my Firefox account or not. My Old Firefox folder hasn't been updated since December and the json file in there has nothing in it.

I love using Firefox. Its my go-to browser. I don't use any other browser at all. If someone could let me know whet the heck is happening I would appreciate it.

Steve Bowman

content: I just used pacman to update to the latest Firefox, but the tab crashed each time I open a new web page ( I can open settings, about:xxx and etc... ). I tried Troubleshoot Firefox crashes and it did not crash in troubleshoot mode. Then I tried extensions, themes and hardware acceleration issues to solve common Firefox problems https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/troubleshoot-extensions-themes-to-fix-problems but non of these options solved the problem. I disabled all extensions, themes and hardware acceleration, and it reported the same error.
creator: 2014762174a

title: Initial startup time is several times longer after update.
content: After the recent update to version 89, FF has gone from 1-2 seconds load time to around 20 seconds, just for the initial load from clicking the icon. The only new things I have done to it since the update was reverting the tabs (disable proton) and setting the menu spacing down to 2px.
creator: fly_007

title: Bookmarks line spacing
content: Firefox 89 expanded the line spacing in my Bookmarks tab. How do I get it back to its original spacing?
creator: merlin0330

title: New version have bugs with GTK Theme Dark while using Light Theme on Firefox (Linux)
content:
Hi, this is killing me. I'm using light theme on Firefox, and my GTK3 theme is Pop Dark, and it's causing a lot windows and box having the theme from GTK Dark and not from Light theme default of Firefox, what is suppose to be.

Some examples on images.

I read in some stack overflow pages, and some foruns, that if I go to about:config, and at option widget.content.gtk-theme-override set some GTK Ligth theme already installed, then it was suppose to solve my problem. But guess? Don't solve. Sounds like this option don't change anything. I try set Pop, that is the Pop light theme. Try Pop:light, and many other variants of this, then same result.

I don't know if this behavior was from previous versions, because I coming to Firefox now, on 89 latest version, and I wasn't test other versions.

Can anyone say if this behavior/issue was from previous version too? Or is this bug from new version 89?

Or so, if anyone have the solution for this. Thanks.

Some informations about my configs:

I use arch, btw. GNOME 40, using Wayland server. GTK3 Theme is Pop Dark. Firefox 89 Version. Firefox theme is Light default theme. Build Mozilla Firefox for Arch Linux, 64 bits. archlinux 1.0.
creator: root.gustavo.mendel

title: new floating tabs
content: I read about new "floating tabs". I assume this refers to tab previews, whether they float or not. I have FF89. I don't got no tab thumbnail previews, floating or not. I don't get it!? Can someone explain. If i need an extension, which one??? Thanks in advance, Vancouver user

title: Can I have a setup with a light theme and a dark one?
content: Is it possible to set up Firefox so that during the night it uses a dark theme and during the day a light one? I haven't been able to find any dynamic theme setups

title: “Firefox is already running, but is not responding. The old Firefox process must be closed to open a new window.”
content: I’ve repeatedly tried both possible options (Close Firefox or Cancel) offered in the “Close Firefox” box referenced as “Subject” above and gave it loads of time to allow Firefox to open. Repeated shut-downs and reboots also no use. I have always accepted every upgrade to Firefox and Windows offered. But Firefox won’t open on my Lenovo laptop fed by Earthlink wifi router. I hope you can help.

title: How do I customize the contents of the macOS Touch Bar in Firefox 89?
content: I seem to remember that, prior to Firefox 89, there was a customize touch bar button in the menu, under Firefox. After updating to Firefox 89, I can't find the button anymore. I looked in the menu and in settings. I tried looking online.
